intro: Ageratina calaminthifolia, commonly known as sweetweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and meadows. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and clustered in a spherical shape. It is often used in traditional medicine and has ornamental value due to its delicate appearance.
